content.title: Mukhyamantri Nirmaan Shramik Pension Sahayata
content.details: Labor Department of Chhattisgarh State started this scheme 'Mukhyamantri Nirmaan Shramik Pension Sahayata' for Building and other construction worker on 29 March 2023. The main objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to compensate the loss in regular income of the beneficiary due to lack of work available to him every day and to ensure smooth functioning of his livelihood.
benefits: Pension to the Beneficiary: ₹ 1,500/- per month
Pension to the widow of the beneficiary: ₹ 700/- per month
eligibility: Beneficiaries should be 60 years old or more.
Beneficiaries must be permanent residents of Chhattisgarh.
Beneficiaries must have registered members as construction workers in the Board for 10 years.
Beneficiaries cannot receive benefits under this scheme if they are already receiving benefits from any other parallel scheme of the State/Central Government.
Registered construction workers who have availed the benefit of the Chief Minister Syan Sahayata Yojana are ineligible for this scheme.
Beneficiaries must submit a survival certificate every year in March to continue receiving the assistance amount.

If both husband and wife are registered workers and both are receiving pension benefits, only one spouse will continue to receive pension after the death of the other. Family pension will not be payable to dependents.

If both husband and wife are registered workers and the husband dies before the wife turns 60, the wife will receive family pension until she turns 60. After turning 60, she can apply for pension under the pension scheme, and the family pension will automatically stop.

Beneficiaries have six months from the date of completing 59 years and three months to 60 years to apply for the scheme. A survival certificate must be submitted in the month when the first pension amount is to be paid.
content.application_process: Online. All the applicants have to visit the official website of Chhattisgarh Labour Department. On the home page click on 'Apply' under 'Chhattisgarh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board'. Enter the required details and submit the application.
documents_required: Original scanned copy of beneficiary's surviving labor registration certificate.
Live photo of husband and wife (or surviving spouse if one is deceased).
Death certificate of deceased beneficiary (for family pension).
Original scanned copy of beneficiary's Aadhaar card.
Original scanned copy of beneficiary's bank passbook.
Life certificate issued by competent authority.
Original scanned copy of age proof document submitted at registration.

faqs.question: What is this scheme?
faqs.answer: Chhattisgarh State Government started a scheme 'Mukhyamantri Nirmaan Shramik Pension Sahayata' for Building and other construction worker on 29 March 2023.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The main objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to compensate the loss in regular income of the beneficiary due to lack of work available to him every day and to ensure smooth functioning of his livelihood.

faqs.question: What are the benefits?
faqs.answer: Pension to the Beneficiary: ₹ 1,500/- per month or Pension to the widow of the beneficiary: ₹ 700/- per month.

faqs.question: Who can get the benefits?
faqs.answer: All eligible construction worker individuals from Chhattisgarh State.

faqs.question: What is the minimum membership eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries must have registered members as construction workers in the Board for 10 years.

faqs.question: May beneficiary get the benefits of other scheme parallelly?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries cannot receive benefits under this scheme if they are already receiving benefits from any other parallel scheme of the State/Central Government.

faqs.question: In which month will the beneficiary have to submit the survival certificate?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries must submit a survival certificate every year in March to continue receiving the assistance amount.

faqs.question: What is the procedure to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicant must be registered under 'Chhattisgarh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board'. Only then can the applicant apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: All the applicants have to visit the official website of Chhattisgarh Labour Department, click on 'Apply' under 'Chhattisgarh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board', provide the required details, fill out the application form, and submit.
